description: SPARSEFS is designed to hold a file system, which is used to emulate the embedded MultiMediaCard (eMMC). The folder most likely contains the root filesystem (root.fs), the kernel (kernel.elf), the initrd file (initrd.img), and the "custpack" (prebundled.fs).
NOTE: The SPARSEFS folder is only used by the Windows version of BlueStacks. It is located in the \​Bluestacks\​Android\​ directory.

common_filenames.description: Data.sparsefs - The name of the folder that contains the data for an app emulated by BlueStacks.
